channel.title: JEditorPane
channel.description:
Unlike JTextArea, JEditorPane doesn't have a method to "append" another line. It can only set the text which ends up replacing the recent text.
Is there a way to make it add a new line while keep the old entries?

item.title: JEditorPane
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“nueb35, post:6, topic:278669”][quote author=la­wl link=topic=367837.msg2786267#msg2786267 date=1242505705]

Try this, it might work:

private String text = area.getText();
area.setText(text + “hai”);

that makes 0 sense, a private local var?

does your text have a in it? afaik you need to have it before any html
[/quote]

this is correct, in a editors pane you have to add things before the so look for in the panes’s text and do
[tt]pane.setText(paneSubStrUpToStartOfBodyEndTag + whateverYouWant + paneSubStrAfterTheStartOfBodyEndTag);[/tt][/quote]
no you dont need to end the body tag, just start it then append after it

item.description:
@openice123 wrote:

It doesn’t work when I do it this way.

area.setText(area.getText()+"<a href="+message+">"+message+"</a>");

But it does when I do it the other way around.

area.setText(<a href="+message+">"+message+"</a>"+area.getText());
